channel.title: Xbox for PC?
channel.description:
I was wondering, if I sold My xbox 360 would I be able to buy a decent gaming computer?
It's an Elite 120GB includes HD cables, Wireless controller, ect. or would it be best to just keep the xbox?

item.title: Xbox for PC?
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
I have both, and I haven’t used my 360 on an extremely long time. I find playing games on the computer more enjoyable, because of the graphics, mod support, and relative ease at starting it up rather than having to boot up my 360… wait for the dash to pop up… select game to play… and then wait for that thing to load… (Not applicable to PC, 'cause it’s always on and loads games quickly. :3)

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox for PC?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
I both regret and don’t regret selling my 360…I regret it because now and then I get the urge to play Rock Band, and thats not exactly something you can do with PC. However, I don’t regret it because at the moment I really needed the money, and in all actuality I hardly used it. Also, I don’t think it’ll ever be like my Super Nintendo, which has sentimental/nostalgia value. Hmm. I should go see if it works or not…last time I tried to use it all I got was corrupted graphics all over my screen. At least there’s still ZSNES if that doesn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox for PC?
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
xalener:

I’d advise against ever selling a system. God knows I regret selling the PS1 and the sega genesis… Fucking hell…

But if you must, it won’t be enough. Not close.

I had both an N64 and Dreamcast…liked them both.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox for PC?
item.dc:creator: Generalismo_Benzino
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Obligatory

Wasn’t yahtzee poking fun at PC gamers with that image? I find it hilarious that I see it all the time, though he is a hilarious guy. If I remember correctly it was in his review of the witcher (the first one).

My rig is a laptop. A sager laptop that cost 1600. They managed to fit a 6870 into that thing with a processor slightly less powerful than the 2500k. Plus it’s 15 inches, only weighs 7 pounds, and has damn decent battery life for a gaming compooter. So basically I have a semi-portable laptop that can do crysis 2 dx11 at ultra at 30 fps average. Count me satisfied.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox for PC?
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Kairouseki:

I regret selling my N64 for a Dreamcast .

That was a mistake.

I’m paying $1000 for mine. Paying as in, charged on a credit card, with theoretical dollars.

item.title: Xbox for PC?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Bolteh:

I threw away my Windows PC and replaced it with an overpriced PC that does everything the Windows PC did (apart from running games)[/SIZE], but with more style.

My lower-than-normal gaming needs have been fulfilled by a PS3 on a 42" HDTV.

Best shit I’ve ever done.

My currency-ePeen has been waved.

Looks like you’re nearing the end of the macfag phase, the last stage is you build a gaming rig. Collision went through the macfag phase, but he was lucky enough to sell his mac on eBay for 1/2 the retail price.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox for PC?
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

Keep the xbox for its exclusive and intended titles, get a job, quit after a month, use the money to buy everything you need.

Nobody wants to play PC ports of console games. Put that shit in your living room for when the chums come over.

thanks, that’s a good idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox for PC?
item.dc:creator: 6gunSimmons
item.description:
Thanks.

Anyway @OP:
My good friend got screwed trading in his brand spanking new xbox slim (about 2 weeks after it came out) for cash towards a rig. He traded in the console (duh), 4 wireless controllers, a wireless mic, halo reach, fag ops, all cables, and a vision cam. They gave him $300 for all that.

Read full topic
